sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"位于"之意。
means: situate ： 通常用过去分词作表语，指某城镇、乡村或某物等的地理位置与环境的关系，即在何处。
lie ： 最常用词，不及物，指国家、城镇、道路、湖海等所处的位置。
stand ： 多指建筑物等被想象为主体的物体立于某处。

word_mean: 胎儿位置，胎儿姿势：胎儿纵轴与母体纵轴的关系，见presentation项下

sentence.Network_en: The blame for the Charleston fiasco did not lie with him.
sentence.Network_cn: 查尔斯顿惨败错不在他。

sentence.Network_en: Lie face upwards with a cushion under your head.
The ship would lie there mirrored in a perfectly unmoving glossy sea.
sentence.Network_cn: 船会停靠在那里，映衬在一片波澜不兴的湛蓝海水之中。

lj.lj_ly: He's lying down on the job.

jx.jx_en_mean: To be in confinement for childbirth.
To remain stationary while facing the wind.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 受阻，滞航：顶风时停滞不动

jx.jx_en_mean: To be decided by, dependent on, or up to
take no action regarding a controversial or problematic matter
jx.jx_cn_mean: 将（有争议或问题的事）搁置，把…束之高阁

jx.jx_en_mean: cause one to feel troubled or uncomfortable
jx.jx_cn_mean: 让人感到麻烦，让人不舒服

jx.jx_en_mean: (of the corpse of a person of national importance) be laid in a public place of honour before burial
jx.jx_cn_mean: （伟人遗体安葬前）受公众吊唁

jx.jx_en_mean: conceal oneself, waiting to surprise, attack, or catch someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: 埋伏准备惊吓（或袭击、抓住）某人

jx.jx_en_mean: (especially of a criminal) keep out of sight; avoid detection or attention

lj.lj_ly: at the time of the murder he appears to have been lying low in a barn.
lj.lj_ls: 看上去谋杀发生时，他一直躲藏在谷仓里。

jx.jx_en_mean: the way in which an area's features or characteristics present themselves
[usu. with negative]accept an insult, setback, rebuke, etc. without reacting or protesting
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［多用于否定］默默承受侮辱（或挫折、指责等）

jx.jx_en_mean: be going to happen; be in store

lj.lj_ly: I'm excited by what lies ahead.
lj.lj_ls: 我为即将发生的事情而激动不已。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of an object) be left carelessly out of place

lj.lj_ly: I became irritated at the pills and potions lying around in every corner of the house.
lj.lj_ls: 房子里到处都是药片和药剂，使我十分恼火。

jx.jx_en_mean: be the real, often hidden, reason for (something)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 是（事件）背后真正的原因

lj.lj_ly: a subtle strategy lies behind such silly claims.
lj.lj_ls: 如此愚蠢的要求背后隐藏着诡秘的计谋。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English licgan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch liggen and German liegen, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek lekhos and Latin lectus 'bed'
Old English lyge (noun), lēogan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch liegen and German lügen

encyclopedia.content: 个人简历 李（Marius Sophus Lie，公元1842年12月17日─公元1899年2月18日）是挪威数学家。生于努尔菲尤尔埃德，卒於克里斯蒂安尼亚（今奥斯陆）。1865年毕业于克里斯蒂安尼亚大学。1869年获奖学金到柏林留学，与克莱因（Felix Klein）在一起工作并结为好友。第二年在巴黎又结识了达布（Gaston Darboux）和约当（Camille Jordan），受到法国学派的影响。1871年回国在克里斯蒂安大学执教，1872年获博士学位。1886年到莱比锡大学（U

entry.def: If you are lying somewhere, you are in a horizontal position and are not standing or sitting.

example.ex: There was a child lying on the ground...
example.tran: 地上躺着一个小孩。

example.ex: The injured man was lying motionless on his back...
example.tran: 那名受伤的男子一动不动地仰面躺在那里。

entry.def: If an object lies in a particular place, it is in a flat position in that place.

example.ex: ...a newspaper lying on a nearby couch...
example.tran: 放在旁边沙发上的一张报纸

example.ex: Broken glass lay scattered on the carpet.
example.tran: 碎玻璃散落在地毯上。

entry.def: If you say that a place lies in a particular position or direction, you mean that it is situated there.

example.ex: The islands lie at the southern end of the Kurile chain.
example.tran: 这些岛屿位于千岛群岛的南端。

entry.def: You can use lie to say that something is or remains in a particular state or condition. For example, if something lies forgotten, it has been and remains forgotten.

example.ex: She turned back to the Bible lying open in her lap...
example.tran: 她将注意力又转回到摊放在腿上的《圣经》。

example.ex: The picture lay hidden in the archives for over 40 years...
example.tran: 这张照片在档案室中藏了40多年。

entry.def: You can use lie to say what position a competitor or team is in during a competition.

example.ex: I was going well and was lying fourth...
example.tran: 我当时发挥不错，排在第四。

example.ex: Blyth Tait is lying in second place.
example.tran: 布莱思·泰特目前名列第二。

entry.tran: （问题、解决方法、过错等）存在，在于
entry.def: You can talk about where something such as a problem, solution, or fault lies to say what you think it consists of, involves, or is caused by.

example.ex: The problem lay in the large amounts spent on defence...
example.tran: 问题在于防务方面耗资巨大。

example.ex: They will only assume that, as a woman, the fault lies with me...
example.tran: 他们只会假定是我出了错，因为我是女人。

entry.tran: （尤指不快或困难之事）将发生，在等待
entry.def: You use lie in expressions such as lie ahead ,lie in store, and lie in wait when you are talking about what someone is going to experience in the future, especially when  it is something unpleasant or difficult.

example.ex: She'd  need all her strength and bravery to cope with what lay in store...
example.tran: 她需要所有的力量与勇气去应付将会出现的问题。

example.ex: The President's  most serious challenges lie ahead.
example.tran: 对总统来说最为严重的挑战还在后面。

entry.tran: （尤用于墓碑上的文字中）长眠
entry.def: Lie is used in formal English, especially on gravestones, to say that a dead person is buried in a particular place.

example.ex: The inscription reads: Here lies Catin, the son of Magarus...
example.tran: 碑文写着：马格勒斯之子卡廷长眠于此。

example.ex: My father lies in the small cemetery a few miles up this road.
example.tran: 我父亲葬在沿这条路往北几英里处的一个小公墓里。

entry.def: If you say that light, clouds, or fog lie somewhere, you mean that they exist there or are spread over the area mentioned.

example.ex: It had been wet overnight, and a morning mist lay on the field.
example.tran: 前一天晚上下了雨，田野上笼着一层晨雾。

entry.def: The lie of an object or area is its position or the way that it is arranged.

example.ex: The actual site of a city is determined by the natural lie of the land.
example.tran: 城市的实际选址取决于这片土地的自然状况。

entry.def: A lie is something that someone says or writes which they know is untrue.

example.ex: 'Who else do you work for?' — 'No one.' — 'That's a lie.'...
example.tran: “你还为谁卖命？”——“没有谁。”——“你撒谎。”

example.ex: I've  had enough of your lies...
example.tran: 我已经听够了你的谎言。

entry.def: If someone is lying, they are saying something which they know is not true.

example.ex: I know he's lying...
example.tran: 我知道他在说谎。

example.ex: If asked, he lies about his age...
example.tran: 有人问起时，他就会谎报年龄。

entry.def: If you say that something lies, you mean that it does not express or represent something accurately.

example.ex: The camera can sometimes lie.
example.tran: 照相机拍出的照片有时也未必可靠。

entry.def: If something gives the lie to a statement, claim, or theory, it suggests or proves that it is not true.

example.ex: This survey gives the lie to the idea that Britain is moving towards economic recovery.
example.tran: 这项调查显示英国经济正在复苏的想法是失实的。

entry.tran: 虚伪地生活；活在谎言之中
entry.def: If you say that someone is living a lie, you mean that in every part of their life they are hiding the truth about themselves from other people.

example.ex: My mother never told my father the truth about me. We've been living a lie all this time.
example.tran: 母亲从来没告诉父亲我的真实身世。一直以来我们都活在谎言之中。

entry.tran: （用于纠正口误）不对，我说错了
entry.def: People sometimes say 'I tell a lie' when they have just made a mistake in something that they are saying and immediately correct it.

example.ex: It is the first scene of the play chronologically. I tell a lie, it's  actually strictly speaking the second scene.
example.tran: 从时间顺序上来看这是整个剧的第一场。不对，严格说来实际上是第二场。

means.word_mean: 1. a statement that deviates from or perverts the truth
2. position or manner in which something is situated
1. be located or situated somewhere; occupy a certain position
2. be lying, be prostrate; be in a horizontal position;

sentences.sentence: "The sick man lay in bed all day"
"the books are lying on the shelf"

means.word_mean: 3. originate (in);

sentences.sentence: "The problems dwell in the social injustices in this country"

means.word_mean: 4. be and remain in a particular state or condition;
5. tell an untruth; pretend with intent to deceive;

sentences.sentence: "She lied when she told me she was only 29"

means.word_mean: 6. have a place in relation to something else;

sentences.sentence: "The fate of Bosnia lies in the hands of the West"

means.word_mean: 7. assume a reclining position;

sentences.sentence: "lie down on the bed until you feel better"

auth_sentence.content: We lie down in the long grass and listen.
auth_sentence.res_content: We lie down in the long grass and listen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We lie down in the long grass and listen.

auth_sentence.content: I lie there and look forward to my dreams.
auth_sentence.res_content: I lie there and look forward to my dreams.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I lie there and look forward to my dreams.

auth_sentence.content: Because the problems that lie ahead are truly enormous.
auth_sentence.res_content: Because the problems that lie ahead are truly enormous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Because the problems that lie ahead are truly enormous.

Sentence.sentence: they lay more emphasis on commitment and devotion
It lies seven miles east of Newton.
Things get stolen when it is easy to steal them because they are left lying around unwatched.
So when fly the north, they might lay eggs in Louisiana and die.
They start to lay eggs when they are nine months old
Only the strongest can reach their destination to lay eggs.

means.word_mean: 躺；卧；平躺；平卧；横卧(常与 down 连用)

sentences.en: He broke his leg and had to lie all the time.
sentences.cn: 他折断了腿, 不得不总是躺着。

sentences.en: The national hero lies buried here.
sentences.cn: 那位民族英雄就安葬在这里。

means.word_mean: 位于, 坐落在

sentences.en: There lies a small town at the foot of the mountain.

means.word_mean: 展现, 伸展, , 铺展, 展开

sentences.en: Ahead lay a vast expanse of wheat.

means.word_mean: 说谎; 撒谎; 编造谎言
处于，保留，保持（某种状态）

sentences.en: The town lay in ruins after a heavy bombardment.
sentences.cn: 在猛烈轰炸以后城镇成了一片废墟。

means.word_mean: 思想、特征、问题等存在；在于(常与 in 连用)

sentences.en: The fundamental way out lies in reform and openness.
sentences.cn: 根本出路在于改革开放。

means.word_mean: (风)保持某一方向；位于特定方向

sentences.en: We should first see where the wind lies.
sentences.cn: 我们应该首先看看风向如何。

means.word_mean: 平放

sentences.en: The books have been lying here ever since they were laid here.
sentences.cn: 这些书自从放在这里就一直未动过。

means.word_mean: 谎言；谎话；假话

sentences.en: He tried to tell me a lie about losing his wallet.
sentences.cn: 他试图使我相信他丢失了钱夹的谎言。

means.word_mean: 说谎，撒谎，讲假话

sentences.en: The child lied to the teacher about his reasons for being late.
sentences.cn: 孩子向老师谎报迟到的原因。

means.word_mean: (事物)给以错觉；造成假象；不可靠；欺骗

jushi.english: It lies at a month's distance from here.
jushi.chinese: 它离这儿有一个月的路程。
光明的未来展现在面前。
